DOC.brief_title: Antioxidant Supplementation Pregnant Women With Low Antioxidant Status
DOC.detailed_description: Preeclampsia still remain leading cause feto-maternal mortality morbidity develop develop world . Despite intensive research , underlie pathologic mechanisms disease remain elusive . It agree incomplete absent transformation spiral artery replace endothelial cell mural vascular smooth muscle cell observe placental bed preeclamptic patient severe case intrauterine growth restriction . Oxidative stress propose link mechanism . However , demonstrate two large study antioxidant supplementation reduce risk preeclampsia . Our initial study show antioxidant supplementation may reduce risk preeclampsia pregnant woman low antioxidant status . Comparison ( ) : adverse pregnancy outcome vitamin C E give placebo give pregnant woman low antioxidant status 10-12 week gestation age
DOC.criteria: Agree consent form , consent protocol research Known healthy singleton 610 week pregnant woman Blood pressure > 135/85 Proteinuria History current use antihypertensive medication diuretic Use vitamin C > 150 mg and/or E > 75 IU per day Pregestational diabetes Known placental abnormality . Current pregnancy result vitro fertilization Regular use platelet active drug nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drug Known fetal abnormality Documented uterine bleeding within week screen Uterine malformation History medical complication Illicit drug alcohol abuse current pregnancy Intent deliver elsewhere Known psychologic problem .
